section.name: Normalization step
section.p: This step allow to normalization on expression step results.

ul.li:
Input port:
input: expression file in TSV format (format: expression_results_tsv)
Output: Control graphics, LaTeX report and count matrices (raw, pooled and normalized)

section.name: Required R packages installation
section.p: Eoulsan normalization module use R with DESeq and FactoMineR packages as statistical backend. Normalization module was tested with R 2.15, DESeq 1.8.3 and FactoMineR_1.20. You need to install two R packages on your computer or Rserve server:

subsection.name: Null count proportion barplot
subsection.div: This barplot represent the null count proportion in all sample. This gives a first idea of expression differences.

subsection.name: Total count barplot
subsection.div: This graph represent the total counts for each sample. It also give a first idea of expression differences.
subsection.h4: Raw data (before technical replicates pooling and normalization)

subsection.name: log2(counts + 1) distribution boxplot
subsection.div: This type of graph is useful to see if normalization was performed well. When all boxes are aligned or at least the median, the normalization worked well.

subsection.name: log2(counts + 1) distribution density
subsection.div: This graph show the distribution profiles of each sample. It is useful to verify that technical replicates count distributions are close enough to pool them and to see if normalization have corrected well distribution differences.

subsection.name: Clustering dendrogram
subsection.div: This graph is plotted with hclust R function with the ward method and the distance used is 1-(correlation/2). It it useful to see if replicates are grouped together.

subsection.name: PCA scatter plot
subsection.div: This graph have the same goal than the cluster dendrogram but it is more easy do read.

Warning : as we can see on this graph if some of the samples have a number of total count very higher than the others. The first dimension of the PCA is the count number and the graph isn't really informative in this case.

On this graph like on the corresponding dendrogram we can see that samples of MO_injection and WT_injection are grouped together which is not waiting. Actually, in this experiment injection was performed at 2 different times and these two conditions are control conditions of 2 strains, so these graph shows that there is an "injection time effect" stronger than the difference between the 2 strains.

subsection.name: Count matrix
subsection.div: This module also provide a raw count matrix and a normalized count matrix which can be use for other analysis.
